docs.summary: Describes the Point of Sale (POS) integration to be called by Wix and received by the POS provider third-party. This integration is used to synchronize menus (catalogs) between Wix and the third-party and to create orders originally generated with Wix in the third-party system. Here we describe the SPI and API endpoints you need to implement in your app.

params.name: accountId
params.doc: Merchant's account ID with the POS system.

params.name: configurationId
params.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

params.name: order
params.doc: Details of the order being created on the Wix site.

params.name: paidByPosGateway
params.doc: Whether the order is being paid by the same payment gateway as the POS.

docs.summary:
This endpoint creates a new order in the POS service provider's system based on an 
 order created on a Wix site.

 Wix calls this endpoint when a customer's submits an order and the order is accepted by the site owner.
 
 > You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 > an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 > and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: Create order - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

params.name: accountId
params.doc: The ID for the account between the merchant and the POS service provider.

docs.summary:
This endpoint disconnects the account between the merchant and the POS service provider. 

 The account is not deleted. You can reconnect to the account using the POS integration settings in the Dashboard.
 
 Call the [List Account IDs](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-restaurants/point-of-sale-integration/pos-connectivity-spi/list-account-ids) SPI endpoint to retrieve a list of existing account IDs.

extra.description: Disconnect (toggle off) a specific POS configuration

params.name: configurationId
params.doc: The ID of the merchant's location configuration on Wix.

docs.summary:
This endpoint disconnects the Wix location configuration from a POS service provider's location. 

 The configuration is not deleted. You can reconnect to the configuration using the POS integration settings in the Dashboard.
 
 Call the [List Configurations](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-restaurants/point-of-sale-integration/pos-connectivity-api/list-configurations) SPI endpoint to retrieve a list of existing configuration IDs.

extra.description: Disconnect (toggle off) a specific POS configuration

params.name: accountId
params.doc: Merchant's account ID with the POS system.

params.name: configurationId
params.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

docs.summary:
This endpoint gets the status of the last synchronization between a Wix catalog (menu)
 and the POS service provider's menu.

 Wix calls this endpoint, for example, when a customer navigates to a menu's page on the Wix
 site.
 
 > You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 > an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 > and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: Get catalog sync status - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

docs.summary: This endpoint gets a location configuration by ID on the Wix site.

extra.description: Get a specific POS configuration by id

params.name: accountId
params.doc: Merchant's account ID with the POS system.

params.name: configurationId
params.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

docs.summary:
This endpoint gets the status of a Wix location configuration with the POS 
 service provider from your app. The status determines if point of sale operations are allowed
 for the Wix configuration, such as creating an order.

 Wix calls this endpoint, for example, when a site owner checks the status of a Wix configuration 
 location’s integration with the POS system.
 
 > You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 > an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 > and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: Get configuration status - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

docs.summary:
This endpoint retrieves a list of account IDs for a merchant's restaurant
 (instance) using your app.

 Wix calls this endpoint, for example, when a site owner checks the status of a Wix configuration 
 location’s integration with the POS system.
 
 Each account ID in the response represents an account between the restaurant (instance) 
 and the POS serice provider.

 These IDs can be used, for example, to create an order using the `Create Order` endpoint.

 > You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 > an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 > and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: List account ids - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

docs.summary: This endpoint retrieves a list of location configurations on the Wix site.

extra.description: List all POS configurations on the metasite

params.name: accountId
params.doc: Merchant's account ID with the POS system.

params.name: configurationId
params.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

docs.summary:
This endpoint initiates the synchronization of a catalog as an asynchronous process. The 
 synchronization between a Wix catalog and the POS service provider's catalog starts.

 Wix calls this endpoint, for example, when a customer first activates the POS integration
 by looking at a catalog (menu) on the Wix site or when a 
 site owner synchronizes the catalog.
 
 > You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 > an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 > and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: Sync catalog - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

params.name: accountId
params.doc: Merchant's account ID with the POS system.

params.name: configurationId
params.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

params.name: order
params.doc: Details of the order created on the Wix site.

docs.summary:
This endpoint validates an order in the POS service provider's system.

 Wix can call this endpoint before a customer's order is created on the POS service
 provider's system. This is done to make sure orders can be submitted without errors.
 
 > You cannot try out this endpoint because it has to be implemented by 
 > an app and can have an arbitrary URL. So please ignore the **Authorization** 
 > and **POST** sections below as well as the **Try It Out** button.

examples.title: Validate order - decoded JWT

extra.description: The data payload will include the following object as an encoded JWT. For the purposes of this example, we show the request and response objects decoded.

docs.summary:
Money.
 Default format to use. Sufficiently compliant with majority of standards: w3c, ISO 4217, ISO 20022, ISO 8583:2003.

members.name: value
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string with a period as a decimal separator (e.g., 3.99). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency code. Must be valid ISO 4217 currency code (e.g., USD).

members.name: formattedValue
members.doc: Monetary amount. Decimal string in local format (e.g., 1 000,30). Optionally, a single (-), to indicate that the amount is negative.

Discount description as defined in the catalog.

 Max: 1,000 characters

Transaction ID.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
 This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
 We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
 Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
 Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
 This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
 Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
 (for example, GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
 For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
  it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
 As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
 To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
  message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: originMetaSiteId
members.doc:
A meta site id from which this site was created.

In case of a creation from a template it's a template id.
In case of a site duplication ("Save As" in dashboard or duplicate in UM) it's an id of a source site.

docs.summary:
Hard deletion of the meta site.

Could not be restored. Therefore it's desirable to cleanup data.
Soft deletion of the meta site. Could be restored.
Restoration of the meta site.
First publish of a meta site. Or subsequent publish after unpublish.
Site transferred to another user.

members.name: oldOwnerId
members.doc: A previous owner id (user that transfers meta site).

members.name: newOwnerId
members.doc: A new owner id (user that accepts meta site).

members.name: status
members.doc:
Catalog (menu) synchronization status.

+ PENDING - Synchronization did not start.
+ IN_PROGRESS - Synchronization is in progress.
+ SYNCED - Synchronization ended successfully.
+ FAILED - Synchronization ended with a failure.

members.name: inProgress
members.doc: Synchronization is in progress.

members.name: synced
members.doc: Synchronization succeeded.

members.name: failed
members.doc: Synchronization failed.

members.name: elapsedSeconds
members.doc: Number of seconds since the synchronization process started.

members.name: lastSyncDate
members.doc: Date and time of the latest synchronization process.

members.name: lastSyncDate
members.doc: Date and time of the latest synchronization process.

members.name: lastSuccessfullySyncDate
members.doc: Date and time of the last successful synchronization process.

members.name: reason
members.doc: Failure reason.

members.name: code
members.doc: Error code.

members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Error parameters.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Merchant's account ID with the POS system.

members.name: configurationId
members.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the configuration. 
+ `NOT_STARTED` - This is the initial status for the configuration. The status is set to `NOT_STARTED` after installing the 3rd party integration app and before the integration app is authenticated.
+ `PENDING` - The status is set to `PENDING` after authentication but before completing the app's integration for this configuration.
+ `READY` - Integration for this configuration is completed and the business is ready to activate the integration.
+ `ERROR` - The integration for this configuration did not complete. An error occurred.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Merchant's account ID with the POS system.

members.name: configurationId
members.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_restaurants_posspihost_spi_v1_GetCatalogSyncStatusRequest
messages.displayName: Get Catalog Sync Status Request Object

members.name: configurationId
members.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_restaurants_posspihost_spi_v1_GetCatalogSyncStatusResponse
messages.displayName: Get Catalog Sync Status Response Object

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the catalog (menu) synchronization. 
+ `PENDING` - Synchronization did not yet start.
+ `IN_PROGRESS` - Synchronization has started.
+ `SYNCED` - Synchronization completed successfully.
+ `ERROR` - Synchronization ended with failure.

members.name: statusMode
members.doc: Additional information, depending on the `status` of the catalog (menu) synchronization.

members.name: inProgress
members.doc: Additional information available if the catalog (menu) synchronization is in progress.

members.name: synced
members.doc: Additional information available if the catalog (menu) synchronization has completed successfully.

members.name: failed
members.doc: Additional information available if the catalog (menu) synchronization ended with failure.

members.name: elapsedSeconds
members.doc: Number of seconds that have elapsed since the catalog (menu) synchronization process started.

members.name: lastSyncDate
members.doc: Date and time of the latest catalog (menu) synchronization process.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Error parameters.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: lastSyncDate
members.doc: Date and time of the latest sync process.

members.name: lastSuccessfullySyncDate
members.doc: Date and time of the latest successfully sync process.

members.name: reason
members.doc: Failure reason.

members.name: code
members.doc:
Error code. 
+ `NONE` - No error code available.
+ `OTHER` - Error doesn't resemble the existing synchronization errors.
+ `SYSTEM_ERROR` - A system error occurred during synchronization.
+ `ACCOUNT_NOT_FOUND` - Synchronization failed because the corresponding account with the POS system could not be found.
+ `ACCOUNT_NOT_AUTHORIZED` - Synchronization failed because the corresponding account with the POS system could was not authorized.
+ `LOCATION_NOT_FOUND` - Synchronization failed because the corresponding location with the POS system could not be found.
+ `ACCOUNT_NOT_CONNECTED` - Synchronization failed because the corresponding account with the POS system was not connected successfully.
+ `ACCOUNT_CONFIGURATION` - Synchronization failed because of a configuration error.

members.name: params
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Error parameters.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Merchant's account ID with the POS system.

members.name: configurationId
members.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

members.name: order
members.doc: Details of the order being created on the Wix site.

members.name: paidByPosGateway
members.doc: Whether the order is being paid by the same payment gateway as the POS.

members.name: posOrderId
members.doc: Unique identifier of the order with the POS system.

members.name: posLocationId
members.doc: Unique identifier of the location for the order in the POS system.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Merchant's account ID with the POS system.

members.name: configurationId
members.doc: Unique identifier of the merchant's Wix location configuration.

members.name: order
members.doc: Details of the order created on the Wix site.

members.name: posOrderStatus
members.doc: Status of the order in the POS system.

members.name: appliedAmount
members.doc: Amount saved by redeeming a Wix Loyalty reward.

docs.summary: Details of the order being created on the Wix site.

members.name: id
members.doc: Order ID.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency of the order.

members.name: lineItems
members.doc: Dishes and options included in the order.

members.name: discounts
members.doc: Discounts associated with the order.

members.name: fulfillment

members.doc: Order payment information.

members.name: customer
members.doc: Customer information.

members.name: totals
members.doc: Order totals.

members.name: comment
members.doc: Order comment.

members.name: loyaltyInfo
members.doc: Amount saved by redeeming a Wix Loyalty reward.

members.name: id
members.doc: Configuration ID for the location on the Wix site.

members.name: location
members.doc:
The corresponding Wix location for the configuration, as defined for the Wix site using the Business Info's [Locations](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations) and/or [Site Properties](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/site-properties) APIs, 
 or using [Dashboard Settings](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Select%20Site&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https:%2F%2Fwww.wix.com%2Fdashboard%2F%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D%2Fsettings/business-info).

members.name: catalogId
members.doc: Restaurant catalog ID.

members.name: archived
members.doc: Whether a configuration is archived.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether a configuration is enabled.

members.name: integrationSettingsUrl
members.doc:
URL linking to the POS integration settings in the Dashboard 
 if an online POS ordering app is installed.

members.name: name
members.doc: The Wix location [name](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/business-info/locations/location-object).

members.name: id
members.doc: Configuration ID.

members.name: configuration
members.doc: The merchant's location configuration on Wix.

members.name: configurations
members.doc: The merchant's configurations (locations) on Wix.

members.name: appDefId
members.doc: The app's definition ID.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: The ID for the account between the merchant and the POS service provider.

members.name: configurationId
members.doc: The ID of the merchant's location configuration on Wix.

docs.summary:
This might be extended in the future with pending orders statuses Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED_ORDER_STATUS - Order status can't be classified, due to an error
  • PENDING - Order is pending response from the payment provider - IF THIS WILL REMAIN PAYMENT PROVIDER SPECIFIC, THIS SHOULD BE CLEAR FROM THE NAME - E.G. PENDING_PAYMENT_PROVIDER.
  • NEW - The order is marked as new - wait for state machine
  • ACCEPTED - Order was accepted
  • CANCELED - Order is canceled
  • FULFILLED - Order is fulfilled

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED_DISPLAY_TYPE - DisplayType, due to an error
  • SELECTION - Single choice selection
  • EXTRAS - Multiple choices selection
  • DESELECTION - Allow choices removal

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED_TYPE
  • OFF_ITEM
  • OFF_ORDER
  • OFF_ORDER_MANAGER_DISCOUNT

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED_PAYMENT_TYPE - PaymentType, due to an error
  • CASH - Cash
  • CREDIT - credit
  • DELIVERY_CLUB - Delivery club
  • DELIVERY_COM - Delivery com
  • BITPAY - Bitpay
  • CELLARIX - Cellarix
  • BITSOFGOLD - Bits of gold
  • MULTIPASS - Multi pass
  • TENBIS - Tenbis
  • PAYPAL - Paypal
  • MYSODEXO - Mysodexo
  • WIX_PAYMENTS - Wix Payments

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED_FULFILLMENT_TYPE - Missing type due to an error
  • PICKUP - Pickup
  • DELIVERY - Delivery
  • DINE_IN - Dine-in

Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED_ON_ARRIVAL_TYPE - Missing type due to an error
  • BUZZ_DOOR - Buzz the door
  • CALL_ME - Phone me

Possible values are:
  • WIX
  • POS

Possible values are:
  • API
  • LOCATION_EVENT
  • RESTAURANT_PROVISIONED_EVENT

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • FROM_ZERO_LOCATIONS_TO_ONE_LOCATION
  • FROM_ONE_LOCATION_TO_ZERO_LOCATIONS

`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • ENABLED
  • DISABLED
  • PENDING
  • DEMO

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • TRASH
  • DELETED
  • PENDING_PURGE

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_NAMESPACE
  • WIX - Default namespace for UGC sites. MetaSites with this namespace will be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • SHOUT_OUT - ShoutOut stand alone product. These are siteless (no actual Wix site, no HtmlWeb). MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • ALBUMS - MetaSites created by the Albums product, they appear as part of the Albums app. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • WIX_STORES_TEST_DRIVE - Part of the WixStores migration flow, a user tries to migrate and gets this site to view and if the user likes it then stores removes this namespace and deletes the old site with the old stores. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • HOTELS - Hotels standalone (siteless). MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • CLUBS - Clubs siteless MetaSites, a club without a wix website. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • ONBOARDING_DRAFT - A partially created ADI website. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • DEV_SITE - AppBuilder for AppStudio / shmite (c). MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • LOGOS - LogoMaker websites offered to the user after logo purchase. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • VIDEO_MAKER - VideoMaker websites offered to the user after video purchase. MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • PARTNER_DASHBOARD - MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • DEV_CENTER_COMPANY - MetaSites with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • HTML_DRAFT - A draft created by HTML editor on open. Upon "first save" it will be moved to be of WIX domain. Meta site with this namespace will *not* be shown in a user's site list by default.
  • SITELESS_BUSINESS - the user-journey for Fitness users who want to start from managing their business instead of designing their website. Will be accessible from Site List and will not have a website app. Once the user attaches a site, the site will become a regular wixsite.
  • CREATOR_ECONOMY - Belongs to "strategic products" company. Supports new product in the creator's economy space.
  • DASHBOARD_FIRST - * It is to be used in the Business First efforts.
  • ANYWHERE - * Bookings business flow with no site.
  • HEADLESS - * Namespace for Headless Backoffice with no editor
  • ACCOUNT_MASTER_CMS - * Namespace for master site that will exist in parent account that will be referenced by subaccounts The site will be used for account level CSM feature for enterprise
  • RISE - * Rise.ai Siteless account management for Gift Cards and Store Credit.
  • BRANDED_FIRST - * As part of the branded app new funnel, users now can create a meta site that will be branded app first. There's a blank site behind the scene but it's blank). The Mobile company will be the owner of this namespace.

Possible values are:
  • OTHER - A valid option, we don't expose all reasons why site might be created.
  • FROM_TEMPLATE - A meta site was created from template.
  • DUPLICATE_BY_SITE_TRANSFER - A meta site was created by copying of the transfferred meta site.
  • DUPLICATE - A copy of existing meta site.
  • OLD_SITE_TRANSFER - A meta site was created as a transfferred site (copy of the original), old flow, should die soon.
  • FLASH - deprecated A meta site was created for Flash editor.

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • NOT_STARTED
  • PENDING
  • READY
  • ERROR

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN - UNKNOWN STATUS.
  • PENDING - Synchronization didn't started.
  • IN_PROGRESS - Synchronization is in progress.
  • SYNCED - Synchronization completed successfully.
  • FAILED - Synchronization completed with failure.

Possible values are:
  • NONE
  • OTHER
  • SYSTEM_ERROR
  • ACCOUNT_NOT_FOUND
  • ACCOUNT_NOT_AUTHORIZED
  • LOCATION_NOT_FOUND
  • ACCOUNT_NOT_CONNECTED
  • ACCOUNT_CONFIGURATION
  • OVERLOADED_MENU

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • NOT_STARTED
  • PENDING
  • READY
  • ERROR

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN - UNKNOWN STATUS.
  • PENDING - Sync didn't started yet.
  • IN_PROGRESS - Sync is in progress.
  • SYNCED - Sync completed successfully.
  • FAILED - Sync completed with failure.

Possible values are:
  • NONE
  • OTHER
  • SYSTEM_ERROR
  • ACCOUNT_NOT_FOUND
  • ACCOUNT_NOT_AUTHORIZED
  • LOCATION_NOT_FOUND
  • ACCOUNT_NOT_CONNECTED
  • ACCOUNT_CONFIGURATION
  • OVERLOADED_MENU
